params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a post by the specified ID.
description:
The `getPost()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a post whose ID matches the given ID.

Unless specified in the `options` parameter, the following fields are not included in the response object: `'CONTACT_ID'`, `'CONTENT'`, `'CONTENT_TEXT'`, `'COUNTERS'`, `'INTERNAL_ID'`, `'METRICS'`, `'SEO'`, and `'URL'`.

examples.title: Get a post by ID
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*     "contentText": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading. #sea #sun",

examples.title: Get a post by ID with additional fields
body: *    "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*    "contentText": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading. #sea #sun",

params.name: slug
params.doc:
Slug of the post to retrieve.

The end of a post's URL, for example, `https:/example.com/blog/post/my-post-slug`. Case sensitive and generally based on the post title if not specified.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a post by the provided slug.
description:
The `getPostBySlug()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a post whose slug matches the given slug.

The `slug` is the end of a post's URL that refers to a specific post. For example, if a post's URL is `https:/example.com/blog/post/my-post-slug`, the slug is `my-post-slug`. The slug is case-sensitive, and is generally derived from the post title, unless specified otherwise.

Unless specified in the options parameter, the following fields are not included in the response object: 'CONTACT_ID', 'CONTENT', 'CONTENT_TEXT', 'COUNTERS', 'INTERNAL_ID', 'SEO', and 'URL'.

examples.title: Get a post by its slug
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

examples.title: Get a post by slug with additional fields
body: *     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*     "contentText": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading. #sea #sun",

description:
The `getPostMetrics()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a post's metrics given a specified `postId`.

A post's metrics include the comments, likes, and views that a post receives.

examples.title: Get the metrics of a post

docs.summary: Gets the total amount of published posts of the blog.
description:
The `getTotalPosts()` function returns a promise that resolves to the total amount of published posts on your blog's site.

It can be filtered to return a promise that resolves to the total amount of posts written in a specified language.

examples.title: Get the total amount of posts in the blog
Get total number of posts in a specified language

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of published posts.
description:
The `listPosts()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 published posts.

Using the options parameter, you can filter your list of posts, set the amount of posts to be returned, and sort your list in a specified order.

By default, the list is sorted by `firstPublishedDate` in descending order, and the amount of posts returned is 50.

examples.title: List posts from a blog
body: *       "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

examples.title: List posts from a blog with filter, sorting and paging options
body: *       "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",
*       "excerpt": "Let's talk about choosing best peppers for amazing peppercorn sauce",

extra.description: This example uses the options parameter to filter, sort, and page the posts from a blog.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying time frame, sort, and filter.

ret.doc: Get Blog Post Count Stats response

docs.summary: Retrieves the number of published posts per month within a specified time frame.
description:
The `queryPostCountStats()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a the number of posts per month within the specified time frame.

You can set the time frame using the `rangeStart` and `months` properties. The time frame will start at the 1st of the month set in `rangeStart`. It will cover the amount of months set in `months` and will end on the last day of the last month of the time frame.
For example, if you set `startRange` to `'2022-03-13'` and set `months` to `'4'`, the time frame will be from `2022-03-01` until `2022-06-30`.

>**Note:** If there exists a month without any published posts, that month is skipped in the response.

extra.description: This example uses `queryPostCountStats()` to retrieve the `postCount` of published posts per month.

examples.title: Get post count per month within a given time period

extra.description: This example uses `queryPostCountStats()` to retrieve the `postCount` of published posts per month within a given time frame.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of posts.
description: The `queryPosts()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of up to 100 posts, and returns a [PostsQueryBuilder](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-blog-backend/post/postsquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the `find()` function.
You can refine the query by chaining `PostsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `PostsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryPosts()` returns.
`queryPosts()` runs with these `PostsQueryBuilder` defaults that can be overridden:
Note that the default limit is 50, but the max limit is 100.
To learn how to query posts, see [Field Support for Filtering and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-blog/blog/filter-and-sort).
The following `PostsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for queryPosts(). For a full description of the Posts object, see the object returned for the `items` property in PostsQueryResult.

examples.title: Retrieve a list of all posts

*     "excerpt": "This is a recipe how to create popcorn rub for chicken.",
*     "excerpt": "Let's talk about choosing best peppers for amazing peppercorn sauce",
*     "excerpt": "Create a blog post subtitle that summarizes your post in a few short, punchy sentences and entices your audience to continue reading....",

members.name: liked
members.doc: Is post liked by the current user

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link should not be followed

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: disable auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes (enabled by default).

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: header
members.doc: Deprecated - Changed to rowHeader and columnHeader

members.name: children
members.doc: Tag inner content e.g. `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: props
members.doc: SEO tag attributes/properties (name, content, rel, href).

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.
